pr_title: handleDeckSelection uses a function for cards in learning instead of reset

timeline.message:
Uses lrnDueFromToday istead of counts

At this point in the code, we already know that there are no due cards
new/in review/or in learning and already due. So in
```java
studyOptionsCounts[0] + studyOptionsCounts[1] + studyOptionsCounts[2] > 0
```
we know that `studyOptionsCounts[0]` and `studyOptionsCounts[1]` are
0, and so `studyOptionsCounts[2]>0`. This number contains the number
of cards in learning. We also know there are no cards in learning,
already due, from previous days. So this number simply represents the
number of cards in learning, reviewed the same day, and not yet
due. This is why `lrnDueFromToday` is acceptable.

Furthermore, `.counts` was the only method in which used the state set
by `reset`, so this method can now be removed (anyway, another call to
`reset` will occur if required before a card is taken or when the
study option change the cards to study.

timeline.message:
lrnDueFromToday

This method allows to check whether a card in learning will be due
today; it avoids to reset entirely the deck, and so allows to decide
quickly what action should be done when a deck is selected and no
cards can be seen immediatly.
